result.title: Easy Problem
result.content:
There are N tubs of water, numbered from 1 to N. Initially there is a few litres of water in each tub. Each water tub has 2 taps attached to it. Incoming Tap with speed x litres / second and Outgoing Tap with speed y litres / second.

Let water(i) denote the final volume of water in ith tub.

Josh wants to attain such a situation that water(i) < water(i+1) for 1<=i <=N. i.e. water in each tub must be less than water in the tub next to it. He wants to do this as quickly as possible.

You task is to find out and tell Josh, what is the minimum number of seconds required to attain in this situation.

I/P: 3 //No of Tubs

//initial_volume speedx speedy

2 3 3
3 4 5

3 5 5

O/P:1
